texts.definition: Games where teams compete against teams.
markups: Games typically make players compete with each other. When the designs match players together in <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> to compete against other <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> they provide "Team vs. Team" or <style="CurrentLink">TvT</style> gameplay.

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/American%20Football">American Football</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Ice%20Hockey">Ice Hockey</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Soccer">Soccer</link></style> are all <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Sports">Sports</link></style> that have <style="CurrentLink">TvT</style> gameplay. Likewise, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Counter-Strike%20series">Counter-Strike series</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Defense%20of%20the%20Ancients%20series">Defense of the Ancients series</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Team%20Fortress%20series">Team Fortress series</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/League%20of%20Legends">League of Legends</link></style> are <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Online%20Games">Online Games</link></style> built around team play (and perhaps not too surprising most are examples of e-sports).

<style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Bloodbowl">Bloodbowl</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Hattrick">Hattrick</link></style> are examples where teams compete against each other but individual players control whole teams. In <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/RoboCup">RoboCup</link></style> the team members are all robots, and people's involvement consists of creating and programming the robots.

<style="CurrentLink">TvT</style> gameplay is introduced in games to make <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> compete against each other, which more or less is simply applying the patterns of <style="Link"><link="last-man-standing">Last Man Standing</link></style> or <style="Link"><link="pvp">PvP</link></style> on <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> instead of on players. Like <style="Link"><link="player-balance">Player Balance</link></style> can be applied to <style="Link"><link="pvp">PvP</link></style> gameplay, <style="Link"><link="team-balance">Team Balance</link></style> can be applied to <style="CurrentLink">TvT</style> gameplay through

<style="Link"><link="team-development">Team Development</link></style>. <style="Link"><link="beat-leader">Beat the Leader</link></style> and the need for <style="Link"><link="tiebreakers">Tiebreakers</link></style> may occur in both cases. The use of <style="Link"><link="sanctioned-cheating">Sanctioned Cheating</link></style> may require not only the players engaging in it to perform <style="Link"><link="bluffing">Bluffing</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="roleplaying">Roleplaying</link></style> to succeed with the <style="Link"><link="stealth">Stealth</link></style> goals of not letting other players notice what they are doing, but also other members of their <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style> that are aware of the subterfuge. This can create <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style> among all involved as well as those suspecting that somebody is cheating.

Considering how to handle <style="Link"><link="early-leaving-players">Early Leaving Players</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="late-arriving-players">Late Arriving Players</link></style> are even more likely to be important that in other <style="Link"><link="multiplayer-games">Multiplayer Games</link></style> since the absence of any player can several disrupt other players gameplay; <style="Link"><link="ai-players">AI Players</link></style> can be used to mitigate this problem in some cases (the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style> is an example of how this can be done). Supporting players to handle these two patterns and coordinate themselves before gameplay occurs can motivate <style="Link"><link="game-lobbies">Game Lobbies</link></style> in games that have <style="Link"><link="mediated-gameplay">Mediated Gameplay</link></style>.

Like any game with <style="Link"><link="teams">Teams</link></style>, <style="CurrentLink">TvT</style> can create <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style>. However, what is noteworthy for <style="CurrentLink">TvT</style> is that the experience of <style="Link"><link="togetherness">Togetherness</link></style> can also extend to those in the other teams each if they are competing against each other since they have share the same game sessions or game instances.
